Comment: I agree with you about our tax dollars being extorted from us and then misappropriated for gain of function research.   However, IMO you might want to choose a different allegory than Pilate washing his hands for yourself. Pilate still agreed to crucify Jesus to mollify the Jewish leaders who clamored for his death. The gesture of washing his hands after proclaiming Jesus‚Äô fate was a Jewish tradition and, as a Roman, said act was only paying lip service. I know that the phrase ‚Äúwashed my hands of it‚Äù does mean a claim of innocence, but claiming directly to be Pilate is a murky interpretation/extrapolation of that at best.   A better allegory might be Jesus‚Äôs righteous anger at the money changers in the temple. In this case, anger against those who mis-spent our money on dangerous ventures to be handled by those of questionable repute might be a better fit.
